Title: Profitability Systems Project Manager
RoleDescription: SYSTEM, PROCESS OPTIMISATION AND CPM TOOL IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTSIn this role, you'll lead project teams and projects from end to end: from project planning, over understanding and documentation of business requirements (BSS), to system testing, implementation and training the users. Those projects include system enhancements, new developments as well as the implementation of CPM tools in Red Bull subsidiaries worldwide. Depending on the projects complexity, urgency, and length, you'll define which approach and methodology to apply to achieve the project goals best. You'll be expected to challenge the status quo, facilitate discussions, as well as continuously identify and manage various project and process dependencies. For this reason, a proven track record of stakeholder management and strong communication skills is vital for this role. An understanding of complex technical solutions, general technical affinity and prior experience with system implementation is essential.BUSINESS PARTNER FOR LOCAL MARKETS AND HQIn this role, you'll be a partner for both subsidiaries and HQ in establishing and fully taking advantage of the potential of the CPM system, with a focus on business processes. You'll collaborate with sales, revenue management, finance and operations teams to capture business requirements and keep a strong alignment on the short and long-term strategy. Hence, it is important that you have a solid and diverse business background in order to understand and challenge different cross-functional topics.SYSTEM SUPPORT, DATA AND PROCESS QUALITYYoull act as a global point of contact for the CPM tool and help local key users around the world in case of process or system-related issues and questions. Thereby, youll ensure proper system functioning, find efficiencies and tackle areas of opportunity concerning system handling and related business processes within the CPM system. Furthermore, youll work on initiatives that aim to support subsidiaries in optimizing their cross functional processes and improving their data quality.TRAINING OF THE ORGANISATIONAnother task is the conception and creation of trainings and workshops as well as the preparation of related materials and documentation. Youll hold on-site and online trainings for the system users of our subsidiaries to ensure proper system handling and to strengthen the connection with key users.At least 4 years of relevant experience in Project Management/ Finance/ Controlling/ Product Management/ IT/ SalesUniversity Degree in Business Administration or Finance or ITStrong IT skills and technically savvy, familiarity with ERP systems or any integrated business analytics tool is an advantage (SAP - CRM, ERP (SD, FI, COPA, CCM), S4/HANA, SAC, BI or Essbase, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.)Experience in the FMCG industry and/or focus on sales controlling or revenue management is an advantageAbility to understand complex processes, identify risks and find solutionsResults-oriented team player with strong communication and presentation skillsHighly organised, proactive and passionate for learningDue to legal reasons we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is EUR 2,446 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary.As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin.
